title: High Public Debt Service Burden
description: In 2023, Angola's public and publicly guaranteed debt service reached 13.84% of its Gross National Income, indicating a significant financial burden on the country's economy.

title: Low Educational Attainment
description: As of 2021, only 0.13% of Angola's population aged 25 and above had attained at least a Bachelor's degree, reflecting challenges in higher education access.

title: High Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2018, 35.53% of Angola's population spent more than 10% of their household income on health care, highlighting the financial strain on households.

title: Significant Net Liabilities
description: In 2017, Angola's net incurrence of liabilities was 20.42% of its GDP, indicating a substantial increase in financial obligations.

title: High Remittance Transaction Costs
description: In 2021, the average cost of sending remittances to Angola was 16.86%, one of the highest globally, impacting the financial support received by families.

title: Low Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, only 3.54% of Angola's public debt service was directed towards multilateral debt, indicating a lower reliance on multilateral financial institutions.

title: Low Claims on Domestic Economy
description: In 2023, claims on other sectors of Angola's domestic economy were just 10.12% of GDP, suggesting limited financial sector exposure.
